body_html:
In my case, using :

Keras.backend.clear_session()

right after I am done with a model and before calling or instantiating a new one solves the problem (assuming a single model runs well without issues).

I found the answer here (full credit to that poster):
http://forums.fast.ai/t/how-could-i-release-gpu-memory-of-keras/2023/11

body:
In my case, using :

`Keras.backend.clear_session() `

right after I am done with a model and before calling or instantiating a new one solves the problem (assuming a single model runs well without issues).

I found the answer here (full credit to that poster):
http://forums.fast.ai/t/how-could-i-release-gpu-memory-of-keras/2023/11
